item.title: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group's Net Profit Rose Sharply
item.description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group’s first-quarter net profit rose sharply from a year earlier, thanks to gains on debt securities, higher fees and lower credit costs.

item.title: Glynn's Take: Australia's Economy on Track for Soft Landing as Lowe Prepares Exit
item.description: As Philip Lowe prepares to leave his job as the governor of the Reserve Bank of Australia, it is likely he will do so knowing that the economy is steering with greater certainty toward a soft landing.

item.title: US Economic Resilience Could Lift Dollar Further in August
item.description: The strength of the U.S. economy compared with the eurozone is expected to benefit the dollar in August and weigh on EUR/USD, Danske Bank Research said.

item.title: Atos in Talks to Sell Tech Foundations Arm
item.description: Atos is in exclusive talks to sell its Tech Foundations business to EP Equity Investments for €2 billion, including debt.

item.title: BP Misses Forecasts But Starts Buyback
item.description: BP posted a sharply lower replacement-cost profit of $2.6 billion in the second quarter, hit by weaker oil-and-gas trading, and launched a $1.5 billion buyback program.

item.title: Diageo Profits Rise; Backs Medium-Term Guidance
item.description: Diageo reported profits and sales for fiscal 2023 that came in below expectations, despite above-consensus organic net sales growth of 6.5%, and confirmed its 2023-25 projections for sales and operating profit growth.

item.title: Nikkei Rises 0.9%, Led by Auto, Machinery Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in auto and machinery stocks as hopes for earnings growth continues.

item.title: TPG Telecom in Talks With Vocus Over $4.23 Billion Fixed Assets Sale
item.description: TPG Telecom is in talks over the potential sale of nonmobile fiber assets, including its wholesale residential fixed-asset business, following an indicative proposal of $4.23 billion from Vocus Group.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Decline; New Economic Data in Focus
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields were marginally lower in early European trading, having largely digested last week’s ECB move and a series of end-month economic data.

item.title: Elon Musk's X Sues Nonprofit That Accused It of Allowing Hate Speech
item.description: Elon Musk’s social-media company is suing a nonprofit that has accused the platform of allowing the proliferation of hate speech.

item.title: Uniper Back in Profit, to Invest Billions in Green Shift
item.description: Uniper posted adjusted earnings of €3.7 billion for the first half and said it planned to invest more than €8 billion through 2030 in its green transformation, tripling its average annual investment.

item.title: RBA Extends Rate Pause for Second Month as Inflation Cools
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia left its official cash rate on hold, but left the door open to tightening further if inflation remains sticky and the job market stays tight.

item.title: Daimler Truck Keeps Outlook as Profits Jump
item.description: Daimler Truck reported a 41% rise in adjusted earnings in the second quarter and backed its full-year guidance but its shares fell on below-forecast order numbers.

item.title: Deutsche Post Lifts Outlook Slightly Despite Weaker Second Quarter
item.description: Deutsche Post raised the lower end of its guidance for 2023 despite reporting a 27% drop in second-quarter underlying earnings, hurt by a combination of weaker demand and comparisons with last year’s record results.

item.title: HSBC First-Half Profit Surged to $17 Billion
item.description: HSBC raised its 2023 guidance for net interest income, with profit more than doubling in the first half.

item.title: Toyota Motor Profit Surged on Easing of Chip Shortage
item.description: Toyota Motor said its first-quarter net profit rose 78% from a year earlier as a shortage of chips eased and sales grew across markets.

item.title: DeSantis Super PAC Has $97 Million, Trump Committees Burning Cash on Legal Bills
item.description: So-called super political-action committees can raise unlimited sums and buoy campaigns with independent expenditures on ads.

item.title: The Storm Shadow Missiles Giving Ukraine Long-Range Capabilities
item.description: Storm Shadow missiles equip Ukraine’s counteroffensive with the ability to hit Russian targets far behind the frontlines. The WSJ explores how the weapon works and why it’s forcing Moscow to rethink its logistics.

item.title: The eurozone economy returned to modest growth in the three months through June, but persistent headwinds could portend another difficult economic winter for the region this year.
item.description: The eurozone economy returned to modest growth in the three months through June, but persistent headwinds could portend another difficult economic winter for the region this year.

item.title: Fox is closing Fox Bet, the broadcaster's sports-betting venture, after it failed to grow as quickly as more dominant competitors in the U.S. online-gambling market.
item.description: Fox is closing Fox Bet, the broadcaster’s sports-betting venture, after it failed to grow as quickly as more dominant competitors in the U.S. online-gambling market.
